long_description: = RightScale "repo_git" Provider == DESCRIPTION: Provides the GIT implementation of the 'repo' resource to manage source code download from GIT repositories. == REQUIREMENTS: * Requires repo LightWeight resource cookbook https://github.com/rightscale/rightscale_cookbooks/tree/master/cookbooks/repo or your own implementation of "repo" resource. See "repo" cookbook readme for details. * Requires a virtual machine launched from a RightScale-managed RightImage. == COOKBOOKS DEPENDENCIES: Please see metadata.rb file for the latest dependencies. * rightscale * repo == KNOWN LIMITATIONS: There are no known limitations. == SETUP/USAGE: * Provider will be automatically initialized when you add "repo:default" recipe to your ServerTemplate runlist * Once setup, use the recipes in the 'repo' cookbook to install and manage your code repo. See the repo/README.rdoc for usage details. * Select 'repo_git' option in repo/default/provider input. * To perform correct operations repo/url, and repo/branch inputs must be filled. * To access to private git repositories repo/ssh_key input must contain string with private ssh key or 'key'-type variable from RightScale dashboard. == DETAILS: === General The 'repo_git' implementation can be called with help of Lightweight Resource, which can be found in the repo cookbook. For more about Lightweight Resources and Providers (LWRPs), please see the Rigtscale Guide at: http://support.rightscale.com/12-Guides/Chef_Cookbooks_Developer_Guide/08-Chef_Development/Lightweight_Resources_and_Providers_(LWRP) === Attributes: none === Templates: none === Definitions: none === Libraries-helpers: RightScale::Repo::Ssh_key.create(ssh_key) Create bash script, which will set user defined ssh key required to access to private git source code repositories. Parameters ssh_key(String):: Git private ssh key Raise RuntimeError:: if ssh key string is empty RightScale::Repo::Ssh_key.delete Remove bash script created by create method, after successful pull operation. Parameters none === LWRPs: repo_git provider is defined in providers/default.rb file, it contains source for :pull and :capistrano_pull actions. For more info about these actions please see repo cookbook readme. repo_git provider allows to get source code from GIT remote repositories. It supports repositories with public and private (ssh key protected) access. For normal operations it requires "repo" resource which will act as interface to all repo_git provider logic. ===== Actions: :pull Standard repo pull. Your source code repository will be pulled from remote url to specified destination. :capistrano_pull Perform standard pull and then capistrano deployment style will be applied. ===== Usage Example: For usage examples please see corresponding section in repo cookbook readme. = LICENSE: Copyright RightScale, Inc.
